TopicTitle: TR4 wheels and rover interaction with terrain

Articles.Content:
A short-ish video to illustrate the issues I'm having.

1. The TR4 wheel seriously lacks torque. Compare to the TR-2L which, while it has its own issues, absolutely flies up hills. I don't think this wheel needs to be as excessive as the TR-2L but it should be able to climb a 15 degree slope. I'm having trouble with anything over 5 degrees and have to use frequent switchbacking to navigate terrain.

2. Random craft interactions with terrain. You can see the wheels dip below the terrain on a few occasions followed at the end by the rover dying for no apparent reason.

You can't give me all this beautiful terrain and not expect me to drive it.

KSP2 0.1.2.0

I'm having trouble getting up a 5 degree slope with the TR4. Also seeing the wheels dip below the terrain and hitting invisible bumps - one of which flipped my rover end for end when I hit it at 3 m/s.
